title: Chapter 1: Course Introduction and Overview
description: Introduction to the course, its objectives, and the application areas of machine learning.

title: Chapter 2: Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering
description: Overview of data preprocessing techniques and the importance of feature engineering in machine learning.

title: Chapter 3: Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering (continued)
description: Continuation of techniques for data preprocessing and strategies for effective feature selection.

title: Chapter 4: Supervised Learning: Linear Regression
description: Introduction to linear regression, its implementation and application in supervised learning tasks.

title: Chapter 5: Supervised Learning: Logistic Regression
description: Exploration of logistic regression, including its use cases and how it differs from linear regression.

title: Chapter 6: Supervised Learning: Decision Trees
description: Study of decision tree algorithms, their construction, and application in classification problems.

title: Chapter 7: Supervised Learning: Ensemble Methods
description: Discussion of ensemble methods, focusing on how they improve model performance through integration of multiple models.

title: Chapter 8: Supervised Learning: Neural Networks
description: An introduction to neural networks, covering basic architectures and their application in supervised learning.

title: Chapter 9: Supervised Learning: Neural Networks (continued)
description: Continuation of discussions on neural networks, including advanced techniques and practical implementations.

title: Chapter 10: Unsupervised Learning: Clustering
description: An overview of clustering techniques, exploring methods for grouping similar data points without prior labels.

title: Chapter 11: Unsupervised Learning: Dimensionality Reduction
description: Introduction to dimensionality reduction techniques, examining their importance in simplifying datasets.

title: Chapter 12: Unsupervised Learning: Deep Learning
description: Discussion of deep learning techniques and their applications within unsupervised learning frameworks.

title: Chapter 13: Advanced Topics: Reinforcement Learning
description: Exploration of reinforcement learning concepts and practices, focusing on how machines learn from interactions.

title: Chapter 14: Ethics in Machine Learning
description: Critical evaluation of ethical considerations in machine learning, including case studies and contemporary discussions.

title: Chapter 15: Final Project Work Session
description: Collaborative session for students to work on their final projects, synthesizing course knowledge.

title: Chapter 16: Final Project Presentations
description: Presentation of final projects by student groups, showcasing their machine learning applications and findings.
